task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 254°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade/roofline of the main building straight ahead to estimate its total height, so I'll tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now facing north instead of west, so I need to rotate left to heading 270° to bring the target west-facing building back into view for height estimation.
I should tilt up to capture the roofline and estimate the total number of stories/vertical span of the main building ahead.
The heading has reset to north again, so I must rotate back left to 270° to view the west-facing building and judge its full height.
To estimate height reliably I need both the base and roofline in view, so I'll stay on the building and pitch slightly up rather than moving.
The view is again pointed north, so I need to rotate left to west (270°) while keeping the upward pitch to see the building's top.
To give a final height estimate I need a clear view of the full facade including roofline, so I'll tilt up while keeping the building centered.
Since the heading keeps resetting to north, I will rotate left to 270° again so the west-side main building is in front for estimating its height.
I likely need to step closer to the building to judge story count and scale against doors/windows, so I will move toward the front-right node.
From this new spot I'm angled northwest, so I should rotate left toward ~254°–270° to face the target building squarely for a height estimate.
My previous rotation didn't align to the building; I should rotate left to about 254°–270° (west-southwest) to face it directly.
Rotation seems inconsistent, so I'll use the explicit left-look option to face 215° and then fine-tune toward ~254° if needed.
Now that I'm properly facing west, I should tilt up to include the roofline and estimate height by counting visible stories against typical floor heights.
The heading again shifted to north, so I must rotate left back to 270° while keeping pitch up to view the building top for height estimation.
I should move closer (front-right) to better resolve window/door scale and story count, which will support a more accurate height estimate.
